description.plain:
Little Mix is a British girl band consisting of members Leigh-Anne Pinnock, Jade Thirlwall, and Perrie Edwards. Jesy Nelson, a previous member of the band, announced her departure from the band to focus on her mental health on December 14, 2020. The group has collaborated with numerous artists, including Jason Derulo, Machine Gun Kelly, Missy Elliot, CNCO, Stormzy, and KAMILLE.

The group found fame on X Factor UK Series 8. They auditioned separately, but were put in a group by Kelly Rowland. The girls became the first ever group to win the competition and stole the hearts of viewers.

Their first album, DNA, was released in November 2012. The album boasted singles, including smash hits “Wings,” “DNA,” “Change Your Life,” and “How Ya Doin'.”

Their sophomore album, Salute, was released in November 2013. Singles included “Move,” “Little Me,” and “Salute.”

Get Weird, the group’s third studio album, was released in November 2015, with “Black Magic” being the lead single. Other singles included “Love Me Like You,” “Secret Love Song” featuring Jason Derulo, and “Hair” featuring Sean Paul.

The girls' fourth studio album, Glory Days, was released on the 18th of November 2016, with “Shout Out To My Ex” being the lead single. The song won them their first Brit Award for “British Single”. The re-release Platinum Edition of Glory Days was released on the 24th of November 2017 and featured three new tracks alongside exclusive footage.

LM5, their fifth studio album, was released in November 2018. “Woman Like Me,” a track featuring Nicki Minaj, increased the group’s popularity by winning them the fan-voted award for British Artist Video of the Year at the 2019 Brit Awards, and the award for Best Song at the 2019 Global Awards. Another famous track from the album, “Strip,” features Sharaya J. The track pays homage to girls who are insecure, telling them to acknowledge the physical features they have and to praise them as well.

They released the single “Break-Up Song” in 2020, followed by “Holiday” and “Sweet Melody”. The girls' sixth studio album, Confetti, was released on November 6th 2020, met with overall positive reviews from critics.

The group’s original TV show, Little Mix: The Search aired on BBC One later that year. Their final song featuring Nelson´s vocals was a collaboration with UK producer Nathan Dawe titled “No Time For Tears” and was released on November 25th, 2020.

The now trio’s seventh studio album, Between Us was released on November 12, 2021. It contains the group’s biggest hits, as well as five new songs: “Between Us,” “No,” “Trash,” “Cut You Off,” and “Love (Sweet Love).” On December of that year, Little Mix announced via an emotional Instagram post that the girl group would be taking a break after they finished touring.

songs.full_title: Secret Love Song by Little Mix (Ft. Jason Derulo)
songs.title: Secret Love Song
songs.title_with_featured: Secret Love Song (Ft. Jason Derulo)

description.plain:
Third single released from British girl group Little Mix’s third album Get Weird.

The song is about a Romeo-and-Juliet-like situation, where forbidden love must be hidden behind closed doors and not displayed in public areas such as streets and dance floors. It’s told from two perspectives: the girl’s (Little Mix) and the boy’s (Jason Derulo).

songs.lyrics:
105 ContributorsTranslationsEspañolSecret Love Song Lyrics[Intro: Jesy, Jade]
When you hold me in the street
And you kiss me on the dance floor
I wish that it could be like that
Why can't it be like that?
'Cause I'm yours

[Verse 1: Jade, Jesy]
We keep behind closed doors
Every time I see you, I die a little more
Stolen moments that we steal as the curtain falls
It'll never be enough
It's obvious you're meant for me
Every piece of you, it just fits perfectly
Every second, every thought, I'm in so deep
But I'll never show it on my face

[Pre-Chorus: Jesy]
But we know this
We got a love that is hopeless

[Chorus: Perrie]
Why can't you hold me in the street?
Why can't I kiss you on the dance floor?
I wish that it could be like that
Why can't we be like that?
'Cause I'm yours
You might also like[Verse 2: Jason Derulo]
When you're with him, do you call his name
Like you do when you're with me? Does it feel the same?
Would you leave if I was ready to settle down?
Or would you play it safe and stay?

[Pre-Chorus: Jason Derulo]
Girl, you know this
We got a love that is hopeless

[Chorus: Perrie & Jason Derulo]
Why can't you hold me in the street?
Why can't I kiss you on the dance floor?
I wish that it could be like that
Why can't we be like that?
'Cause I'm yours

[Bridge: Jason Derulo, Leigh-Anne, Leigh-Anne & Jason Derulo]
And nobody knows I'm in love with someone's baby
I don't wanna hide us away
Tell the world about the love we making
I'm living for that day, someday

[Breakdown: Jason Derulo, Jesy]
Why can't I hold you in the street?
Why can't I kiss you on the dance floor?
I wish that we could be like that
Why can't we be like that?
'Cause I'm yours, I'm yours
[Chorus: Leigh-Anne, Jason Derulo, Perrie, Perrie & Jason Derulo]
Oh, why can't you hold me in the street? (Hold me in the street)
Why can't I kiss you on the dance floor? (You on the dance floor)
I wish that it could be like that (I wish)
Why can't it be like that? (I wish)
'Cause I'm yours ('Cause I'm yours)
Why can't I say that I'm in love? (I'm in love)
I wanna shout it from the rooftops (Shout it from the rooftops)
I wish that it could be like that (I wish)
Why can't we be like that?
'Cause I'm yours

[Outro: Jade]
Why can't we be like that?
Wish we could be like that52Embed

songs.full_title: Shout Out to My Ex by Little Mix
songs.title: Shout Out to My Ex
songs.title_with_featured: Shout Out to My Ex

description.plain:
“Shout Out To My Ex” is a farewell message to all of the ex-boyfriends of Little Mix’s members. Each of them offers sarcastic thanks to the men for helping to make them who they are today—women who are totally over them and much healthier for it. The lyrics contain a lot of references to Perrie Edwards' ex, Zayn Malik.

The band announced on Twitter that the song would be released after they performed it for the first time on The X Factor. Following its release, the track reached the top of the Official UK Singles Chart, becoming their fourth number-one single in the UK.

Forget that boy, I'm over it

Hope she ain't fakin' it like I did, babe
Took four long years to call it quits

Guess I should say thank you
For the "hate you"s and the tattoos
Oh, baby, I'm cool by the way
Ain't sure I loved you, anyway
Go 'head, babe, I'ma live my life, my life, yeah

Here's to my ex, hey, look at me now
Well, I'm, I'm all the way up, I swear you'll never bring me down

Here's to my ex (Woo!), hey, look at me now
Well, I'm, I'm all the way up, I swear you'll never, you'll never bring me down

Ooh, ooh
You'll never bring me down
Ooh, ooh (Ooh-ooh)
Yeah

You made my heart break and that made me who I am

Oh, oh, oh-oh-oh

Oh, oh, oh-oh-oh (Ooh)

songs.full_title: Woman Like Me by Little Mix (Ft. Nicki Minaj)
songs.title: Woman Like Me
songs.title_with_featured: Woman Like Me (Ft. Nicki Minaj)

description.plain:
“Woman Like Me” is the lead single from Little Mix’s fifth studio album. The song was released on Friday, October 12, 2018, and features guest vocals from Trinidadian-born American rapper, Nicki Minaj.

The Steve Mac-produced track serves as the group’s first single since June 2018’s “Only You” with American EDM trio, Cheat Codes, as it reached the Top 20 of the Official UK Singles Chart. It also marks the group’s return to music after a hiatus since the end of their worldwide tour in November 2017, where they were in the process of making the new album since Spring the same year.

On September 27, the British radio station Capital FM posted on their website an article about the collaboration between the members and Minaj, and a few days later the group was spotted filming the music video. Three days later the group broke the silence by posting an official teaser on social media and unveiled the cover artwork. It breaks off from the casual, colorful aesthetics of the lead singles filled with a pure pop sound, as “Wings” from DNA, “Move” from Salute, “Black Magic” from Get Weird, and “Shout Out to My Ex” from Glory Days.

On October 21, 2018, one week after the song’s release, the band performed “Woman Like Me” for the first time at BBC Radio 1’s Teen Awards as the part of their set.

songs.embed_content: Read “Woman Like Me” by Little Mix on Genius

It also marks the group’s return to music after a hiatus since the end of their worldwide tour in November 2017, where they were in the process of making the new album since Spring the same year.

On September 27, the British radio station Capital FM posted on their website an article about the collaboration between the members and Minaj, and a few days later the group was spotted filming the music video. Three days later the group broke the silence by posting an official teaser on social media and unveiled the cover artwork. It breaks off from the casual, colorful aesthetics of the lead singles filled with a pure pop sound, as “Wings” from DNA, “Move” from Salute, “Black Magic” from Get Weird, and “Shout Out to My Ex” from Glory Days.

songs.lyrics:
130 ContributorsTranslationsEspañolPortuguêsEnglishDeutschFrançaisWoman Like Me Lyrics[Verse 1: Jesy Nelson]
I always say what I'm feeling
I was born without a zip on my mouth
Sometimes I don't even mean it
It takes a little while to figure me out

[Pre-Chorus: Leigh-Anne Pinnock]
I like my coffee with two sugars in it
High heels and my jewellery dripping
Drink and I get all fired up (Hey, hey, hey)
Insecure but I'm working with it
Many things that I could get rid of
Ain't about to give it up

[Chorus: Jade Thirlwall, Perrie Edwards, Jess Glynne]
I made a few mistakes, I regret it nightly
I broke a couple hearts that I wear on my sleeve
My mama always said, "Girl, you're trouble" and
And now I wonder, could you fall for a woman like me
And every time we touch, boy, you make me feel weak
I can tell you're shy and I think you're so sweet
Spending every night under covers and
Still I wonder, could you fall for a woman like me
(A woman)

[Post-Chorus: Jade Thirlwall, Jess Glynne]
Woman like me, like a woman like me
La-la-la, woman like me, like a woman like me (A woman)
La-la-la, woman like me, like a woman like me
La-la-la, woman like me, like a woman like me
You might also like[Verse 2: Jesy Nelson]
And baby, just be mine for the weekend
We can get a takeaway and sit on the couch
